title: Generate a standardized load profile
text: call get_load_profiles() generate load profile steps performed: Generate date sequence start_date end_date Map day combination day period Use result 2nd step extract values load_profiles2 Apply polynomial function values profile H0 Return data3

title: Generate a standardized load profile
text: first step date sequence created start_date end_date based user input. simple example; result vector class Date:

what: Map each day to a period and a weekday
title: Generate a standardized load profile
text: analyzing 1,209 load profiles, study found consumption varies course year days within week. However, also found significant difference consumption Monday Friday group. reason, days Monday Friday grouped together ‘workdays’. December 24th 31th considered Saturday , Sunday, public holidays set Sunday. package supports nationwide, public holidays Germany . retrieved nager.Date API listed 2024: Jan 1: New Year’s Mar 29: Good Friday Apr 1: Easter Monday May 1: Labor Day May 9: Ascension Day May 20: Whit Monday Oct 3: German Unity Day Dec 25: Christmas Day: Dec 26: Boxing Day 3 periods defined : summer: May 15 September 14 winter: November 1 March 20 transition: March 21 May 14, September 15 October 31 result second step mapping date -called characteristic profile day, .e. combination weekday period:
code: wkday_period <- standardlastprofile:::get_wkday_period(date_seq) data.frame(date = date_seq, day = wkday_period) #>         date             day #> 1 2023-12-22  workday_winter #> 2 2023-12-23 saturday_winter #> 3 2023-12-24   sunday_winter #> 4 2023-12-25   sunday_winter #> 5 2023-12-26   sunday_winter #> 6 2023-12-27  workday_winter

what: Assign consumption values to each day
title: Generate a standardized load profile
text: obvious next step assign 1/4-hour power values contained load_profiles data set characteristic profile day created previous step. job get_load_profiles() function. analysis data showed load fluctuations commercial agricultural customers moderate can therefore easily mapped using workday, Saturday Sunday profiles three annual periods. method produces annual load profile customers/customer groups G0 G6 L0 L2, referred study ‘static load profile’, can determined directly 3x3 characteristic profile days. code reproduce plot profile G5 README:
code: G5 <- get_load_profile(profile = "G5",                        start_date = start_date, # defined above                        end_date = end_date) library(ggplot2) ggplot(G5, aes(start_time, watts)) +   geom_line(color = "#0CC792") +   scale_x_datetime(     date_breaks = "1 day",     date_labels = "%b %d") +   labs(     title = "Profile 'G5': bakery with bakehouse",     subtitle = "1/4h-measurements, based on consumption of 1.000 kWh/a",     caption = "data: www.bdew.de",     x = NULL,     y = "[watts]") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(       panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(),       panel.grid.minor.y = element_blank()   ) +   NULL

what: Generate a dynamic load profile H0
title: Generate a standardized load profile
text: contrast commercial agricultural businesses, relatively even fairly constant power consumption course year, households hand continuously decreasing load winter summer (Germany least). fact taken account call get_load_profile() applying 4th order polynomial function values profile H0: \[ x = x_0 (-3.92e^{-10} \times d^4 + 3.20^{-7} \times  d^3 - 7.02^{-5} \times d^2 + 2.10^{-3} \times d + 1.24) \] : \(x\) resulting ‘dynamic’ quarter-hour value \(x_0\) static quarter-hourly value profile \(d\) day respective year, starting 1 January 1st Hence household customers, things look little different, least hood, can seen following graphic. shows aggregated daily values 2023 created beginning vignette:

what: R data package for load profiles for electricity
title: R data package for load profiles for electricity
text: package provides data representative, standardized load profiles electricity German Association Energy Water Industries (BDEW Bundesverband der Energie- und Wasserwirtschaft e.V.) tidy format.

title: R data package for load profiles for electricity
text: can install development version standardlastprofile GitHub :

title: R data package for load profiles for electricity
text: standardlastprofile package contains one data-set called load_profiles. total 9,504 observations five variables: profile: one 11 load profiles period: one ‘summer’, ‘winter’, ‘transition’ day: one ‘saturday’, ‘sunday’, ‘workday’ timestamp: format ‘%H:%M’ watts: electric power standardized load profile simplification necessarily correspond consumption profile individual customer, represents valid approximation larger group similar customers. load profiles can used basis energy utilities create annual consumption forecast customers. combination profile, period day 96 x 1/4h-measurements (watts). idea profile H0 stands , alone. H0: households (German: “Haushalte”) G0 G6: commerce (“Gewerbe”) L0 L2: agriculture (“Landwirtschaft”) 11 different profiles total, call get_load_profile_info() information1.
code: str(load_profiles) #> 'data.frame':    9504 obs. of  5 variables: #>  $ profile  : chr  "H0" "H0" "H0" "H0" ... #>  $ period   : chr  "winter" "winter" "winter" "winter" ... #>  $ day      : chr  "saturday" "saturday" "saturday" "saturday" ... #>  $ timestamp: chr  "00:00" "00:15" "00:30" "00:45" ... #>  $ watts    : num  70.8 68.2 65.9 63.3 59.5 55 50.5 46.6 43.9 42.3 ... get_load_profile_info(language = "EN")$H0 #> $profile #> [1] "H0" #>  #> $description #> [1] "household" #>  #> $details #> [1] "This profile includes all households with exclusively and predominantly private consumption. Households with predominantly private electrical consumption, i.e. also with minor commercial consumption are e.g. sales representatives, home workers, etc. with an office in the household. The Household profile is not applicable for special applications such as storage heaters or heat pumps."

title: R data package for load profiles for electricity
text: Use function get_load_profile() generate load profile. See vignette("algorithm-step--step", package = "standardlastprofile") detailed explanation algorithm2.

title: R data package for load profiles for electricity
text: Data information methodology can found website BDEW: https://www.bdew.de/energie/standardlastprofile-strom/

text: get_load_profile() returns load profiles form quarter-hourly values (Watt) standardized annual consumption 1,000 kWh.

text: https://www.bdew.de/energie/standardlastprofile-strom/ https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/1999_Repraesentative-VDEW-Lastprofile.pdf https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/2000131_Anwendung-repraesentativen_Lastprofile-Step--step.pdf

title: Generate a Load Profile — get_load_profile
text: profiles name load profiles, see 'Details'. start_date start date ISO 8601 date format, required end_date end date ISO 8601 date format, required

title: Generate a Load Profile — get_load_profile
text: data.frame four variables: profile, character, load profile identifier start_time, POSIXct / POSIXlt, start time end_time, POSIXct / POSIXlt, end time watts, numeric, electric power

title: Generate a Load Profile — get_load_profile
text: Supported profiles : H0: households (German: "Haushalte") G0 G6: commerce ("Gewerbe") L0 L2: agriculture ("Landwirtschaft") Call get_load_profile_info() information profiles. standard load profiles differentiated according winter, transitional period, summer well workday, Saturday, Sunday. See: https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/1999_Repraesentative-VDEW-Lastprofile.pdf methodology used determine profiles. Periods defined : summer: May 15 September 14 winter: November 1 March 20 transition: March 21 May 14, September 15 October 31 Dates mapped one three days: saturday: Saturdays; Dec 24th Dec 31th considered Saturday , Sunday sunday: Sundays public holidays workday: Monday Friday Note: package supports nationwide, public holidays Germany . retrieved nager.Date API listed 2024: Jan 1: New Year's Mar 29: Good Friday Apr 1: Easter Monday May 1: Labour Day May 9: Ascension Day May 20: Whit Monday Oct 3: German Unity Day Dec 25: Christmas Day: Dec 26: Boxing Day

title: Get the description load profiles according to the BDEW — get_load_profile_info
code: get_load_profile_info(language = "EN")$G6 #> $profile #> [1] "G6" #>  #> $description #> [1] "weekend business" #>  #> $details #> [1] "Commercial facilities with a clear focus on consumption at weekends. In particular, these are all businesses characterized by the leisure activities of the population: youth clubs, restaurants and cafés, petrol stations with car washes, cinemas with food outlets, sports and leisure facilities." #>  get_load_profile_info(language = "DE")$G6 #> $profile #> [1] "G6" #>  #> $description #> [1] "Wochenendbetrieb" #>  #> $details #> [1] "Betriebe mit deutlichen Verbrauchsschwerpunkt an den Wochenenden. Das sind insbesondere alle durch die Freizeitaktivitäten der Bevölkerung geprägten Geschäfte: Jugendclubs, Ausflugs- und Speisegaststätten, Tankstellen mit Waschanlagen, Kinos mit Verzehr, Sport- und Freizeiteinrichtungen." #>

text: load profile shows variation electrical load versus time. Data provided German Association Energy andvWater Industries (BDEW Bundesverband der Energie- und Wasserwirtschaft e.V.).

title: Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — load_profiles
Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — load_profiles
text: data.frame 9,504 rows 5 parameters: profile character, one 11 load profiles, see 'Details' period character, one 'summer', 'winter', 'transition' day character, one 'saturday', 'sunday', 'workday' timestamp character, format: %H:%M watt numeric, electricity load

title: Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — load_profiles
text: https://www.bdew.de/energie/standardlastprofile-strom/ https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/Profile.zip https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/1999_Repraesentative-VDEW-Lastprofile.pdf https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/2000131_Anwendung-repraesentativen_Lastprofile-Step--step.pdf

title: Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — load_profiles
text: Data differentiated workday, Saturday Sunday three annual periods winter, transitional period summer. Hence profile 96 values per weekday period. 96 values per day correspond average quarter-hourly power expected customer / customer group consumes 1000 kWh/("normalized annual consumption"). Put differently, sum quarter-hourly power values one calender year equals (roughly) 1000 kWh/. Included eleven representative load profiles covering three different customer groups: households: H0 commercial: G0, G1, G2, G3, G4, G5, G6 agriculture: L0, L1, L2 Call get_load_profile_info() get description profile. Periods defined BDEW: summer: May 15 September 14 winter: November 1 March 20 transition: March 21 May 14, September 15 October 31 addition, distinction made three different type days: workday: Monday Friday saturday: Saturdays; Dec 24th Dec 31th considered Saturday , Sunday sunday: Sundays nationwide holidays Germany

title: Load Profile Data for Electricity from BDEW — load_profiles

what: standardlastprofile: R data package for load profiles for electricity — standardlastprofile-package
title: standardlastprofile: R data package for load profiles for electricity — standardlastprofile-package
text: load profile describes consumption profile electricity consumer certain period time. electricity customers without modern meter devices, energy utility uses standardised load profiles (SLP). SLPs replace non-existent load profile end consumers calculated, sufficiently accurate forecast electricity consumption 15-minutes basis. packages provides data German Association Energy Water Industries (BDEW Bundesverband der Energie- und Wasserwirtschaft e.V.) tidy format. eleven profiles, 96 quarter-hourly values included three different days week - workday, Saturday, Sunday - three different seasons - summer, winter, transition -, .e. total 3x3x96 observations per profile.

title: standardlastprofile: R data package for load profiles for electricity — standardlastprofile-package
text: Maintainer: Markus Döring m4rkus.doering@gmail.com
